channel.title: Comments on: Jade HTML Template Engine

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description:
<p>There's a fundamental difference here I think: jade + jQuery are an excellent combination and will suit a lot of simple web app use cases. Where the web app is considerably more complex -- perhaps with a lot of user interaction and state changes within a page, I'd be tempted to look at AngularJS instead, as that's what it's geared up for (and the level of DOM manipulation would be tedious, jQuery notwithstanding).</p>
<p>Another great post Matt!</p>
item.content:encoded:
There’s a fundamental difference here I think: jade + jQuery are an excellent combination and will suit a lot of simple web app use cases. Where the web app is considerably more complex — perhaps with a lot of user interaction and state changes within a page, I’d be tempted to look at AngularJS instead, as that’s what it’s geared up for (and the level of DOM manipulation would be tedious, jQuery notwithstanding).

Another great post Matt!
